body_text:
Inspired by Kuma.
It's a bit hard to tell, but I didn't add any requirements, or change any versions or hashes. I only moved them around, and removed the following

boto==2.39.0 - from when we were going to store things in S3 directly
docutils==0.12 - I'm not sure about this one, but everything works with out it
wheel==0.26.0 - I think this snuck in with a pip freeze
django-adminplus==0.5 - Not using this in the admin anymore.

I would have also removed django-countries==3.4.1, but it is being used in a migration. We could eliminate this if we squished some migrations, but I don't want to do that in this PR.
I tested this by

Pip installing everything into an empty virtualenv
Running the tests
Running ./manage.py collectstatic
Building the docker image
Building the docs
Running the contract tests against ./bin/runsslserver.sh

r?

Inspired by Kuma.

  • boto==2.39.0 - from when we were going to store things in S3 directly
  • docutils==0.12 - I'm not sure about this one, but everything works with out it
  • wheel==0.26.0 - I think this snuck in with a pip freeze
  • django-adminplus==0.5 - Not using this in the admin anymore.

I would have also removed django-countries==3.4.1, but it is being used in a migration. We could eliminate this if we squished some migrations, but I don't want to do that in this PR.

I tested this by

  • Pip installing everything into an empty virtualenv
  • Running the tests
  • Running ./manage.py collectstatic
  • Building the docker image
  • Building the docs
  • Running the contract tests against ./bin/runsslserver.sh

r?
title: Organize dependencies into direct dependencies and sub dependencies
body:
[Inspired by Kuma](https://github.com/mozilla/kuma/tree/master/requirements).

It's a bit hard to tell, but I didn't add any requirements, or change any versions or hashes. I only moved them around, and removed the following
- `boto==2.39.0` - from when we were going to store things in S3 directly
- `docutils==0.12` - I'm not sure about this one, but everything works with out it
- `wheel==0.26.0` - I think this snuck in with a `pip freeze`
- `django-adminplus==0.5` - Not using this in the admin anymore.

I would have also removed `django-countries==3.4.1`, but it is being used in a migration. We could eliminate this if we squished some migrations, but I don't want to do that in this PR.

I tested this by
- Pip installing everything into an empty virtualenv
- Running the tests
- Running `./manage.py collectstatic`
- Building the docker image
- Building the docs
- Running the contract tests against `./bin/runsslserver.sh`

r?
